# cell 1
import time
from itertools import count

import ipywidgets as W
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bridget.helpers import displaydh
from IPython.display import HTML, Image, Javascript, JSON, DisplayHandle, clear_output
counter = count()

# cell 4
import time
time.sleep(2)
displaydh(HTML('cell 4'), metadata={'bridge': {'cell': 4}});

#| hide
# cell 13
w = W.Output()
display(w)
with w:
    print('cell 13.1')
    display('cell 13.2')
    display(HTML('cell 13.3'))

# cell 24
from itertools import count
from bridget.helpers import displaydh
from IPython.display import HTML, Javascript, clear_output
counter = count()
dh0 = displaydh(HTML('cell 24.0'), metadata={'bridge': {'cell': 24.0}})
dh1 = displaydh(
    {'application/x-notebook-state+json': {'feedback': True, 'hide': False, 'debug': True, 'id': next(counter)}}, 
    raw=True, metadata={'bridge': {'cell': 24.1}})

# cell 28
dh1.update({'application/x-notebook-state+json': {'id': next(counter)}}, raw=True, 
        metadata={'bridge': {'cell': 28}})
dh0.update(HTML('cell 28'), metadata={'bridge': {'cell': 28, 'cnt': next(counter)}})

# cell 35
dh2 = displaydh({'application/x-notebook-state+json': {'feedback': True, 'debug': True, 'id': next(counter)}}, 
        raw=True, metadata={'bridge': {'cell': 35}})
# clear_output()

# cell 40
this_id = next(counter)
_ = displaydh(metadata={'bridge': {'cell': 40, 'this': this_id}})
# nb.source.send({'cmd': 'get_state'}, timeout=5)
# clear_output(wait=True)
